tv.source-info-name: Pluto TV Space guide by TV

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Giant Planets: Lords of Gravity
programme.desc: Gravity is one of the most basic and powerful forces shaping our universe. Discover its nature within our own solar system, from the smallest moons to the largest planets.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Fresh Eyes
programme.desc: Two new space telescopes are in orbit and completing their shakedown; Gaia and TESS they too will be joined by the James Webb Telescope.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Living Planet
programme.desc: With continuous observation of arth from orbit scientists have built a data set over time that reveals much about how the Earth breaths and life sustains itself on this living Planet.

programme.title: STAR LIGHT, STAR BRIGHT
programme.desc: The two current science missions to our star; the sun have made great leaps forward in the science of how stars work, how they generate solar winds and how they affect their orbiting planets

programme.title: The New Frontier: Danger, Astreroids Ahead
programme.desc: The question often rises is the cost of space exploration really worth it? Could the money be better spent elsewhere.

programme.title: Spacetime: Silent companions - Moons in our planetary system
programme.desc: Since the beginning of time, the moon has been our loyal companion in the sky. But other planets also have satellites, more so than Earth. But what are moons really, how did they come about and do they actually even carry primitive life?

programme.title: Spacetime: Space Junk - Fast and dangerous
programme.desc: Every mission, every launch of a satellite means more objects in earth orbit. Countless parts are now orbiting our planet. But the waste means a growing danger - not only for manned spaceflight, but also for functioning satellites.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Set Course For Heart of the Sun
programme.desc: NASA’S Parker Solar Probe Mission is on its way and will be shortly followed by Europe’s Solar probe Mission.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Orbit
programme.desc: The International Space Station is undoubtedly the jewel in the crown of low Earth orbit; observation post, research lab and class room.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Getting There
programme.desc: Launching payloads into space is a very difficult task, historically rocket launches are the proverbial 'swords into ploughshares'.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Moons of Olympis
programme.desc: These are the the Moon's of the gas giants. Each a unique and mysterious world of its own. Some have oceans of water, geysers of Sulphur or atmospheres of plastic.

programme.title: The New Frontier: GIANTS IN THE DARK
programme.desc: Asteroids, the debris from the early solar system hold tantalizing clues to planetary formation. The spacecraft Psyche readies to study a unique metallic asteroid.

programme.title: The New Frontier: INCREASING ORBIT
programme.desc: The ISS is the workhorse of the international spacefaring community, but its days are numbered. R

programme.title: The New Frontier: Slingshot
programme.desc: Sending probes throughout the solar system is a mathematicians dream and an engineers nightmare, sling shotting probes around other planets to arrive at their destination.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Science and the Shuttle
programme.desc: For more than 25 years the shuttle was our ticket to space, and our laboratory in orbit. Uncover the legacy of this amazing machine, and see what lies ahead.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Planet Makers
programme.desc: From the beginnings of our Solar System four and half billion years ago there remains tantalizing clues to its evolution; remnent debris: asteroids and comets.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Landsat
programme.desc: Take a look at Landsat 8, the advanced planetary explorer with a 900 million dollar price tag! It is designed to peer across multiple wavelengths to reveal complex and ever-changing details that are undetectable by the human eye.

programme.title: The Fabric of the Cosmos: Quantum Leap
programme.desc: Join Brian Greene on a wild ride into the weird realm of quantum physics, which governs the universe on the tiniest of scales.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Tickets Please
programme.desc: No spacecraft have traveled so fast or so close to a star before. It is hoped to reveal the source of the solar winds that effect us here on Earth

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Astronauts
programme.desc: One hundred kilometres above the Earth’s surface lies an invisible frontier: the edge of space.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Mercury Or Bust
programme.desc: The ESA - JAXA joint Bepi-Colombo Mission is moments away from launch.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Gravity
programme.desc: Gravity has long been a force that has intrigued scientists. Now, for the first time scientists are probing to detect gravity waves in space as well as mapping the gravity patterns of the moon.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Silent Partner
programme.desc: Although we have put man on the moon, our silent partner still holds many mysteries. What haven't we seen? What haven't we discovered?

programme.title: The New Frontier: WEBB OF LIFE
programme.desc: The James Webb Space Telescope is now operational. Launched aboard an Arianne 5 the 10-billion-dollar spacecraft has deployed successfully and reached its orbit around the Sun.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Stars Above
programme.desc: Stars are a bit like human beings. They can be warm or cold, they come in all kinds of shapes and sizes.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Invasion on Mars
programme.desc: The EXO Mars and Curiosity continue their scientific discoveries as we prepare new missions both robotic and manned to the Red planet Mars.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Landing on Mars
programme.desc: Mars sparks our curiosity like no other planet because it is so reachable. Despite having landed there, most of the information we gather is still done by instruments in the planet's orbit.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Ice Giants
programme.desc: Beyond the asteroid belt lay the ice giants, some can be seen with the naked eye, others only glimpsed once by a passing probe.

programme.title: The New Frontier: From There To Here
programme.desc: Series introduction and the study of Earth from orbit.

programme.title: EARTH´S EVIL TWIN
programme.desc: Venus is a planet closest to Earth in distance and size, it once may have been as hospitable to life as Earth is now. Then something changed and Venus became shrouded in hot dense toxic clouds.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Next Stop Mars
programme.desc: It has fired our imaginations for millennia, Mars, the God of War and the source of Man's science fictional demise.

programme.title: Spacetime: Destination Mars - From the moon to the red planet
programme.desc: Mankind is entering a new era of space travel. Astronauts are set to return to the moon before the decade is out. And scientists and visionaries say: humans will soon set foot on a foreign planet for the first time: Mars.
